headline: Colossal Squid: Tentacles and Arms
description: A speculative exploration into the anatomical differences between arms and tentacles in the colossal squid, and how these structures might relate to signaling and symbolic expression.
whyItMatters: This post introduces a vital anatomical distinction that may underlie the mechanics of squid-based symbolic interaction. It balances emerging scientific understanding with intuitive speculation.
articleExcerpt: Continuing my fascination with Squid! And Tentacles as communication. This is exploratory science based only off of scant video footage.
sourceFragments: They have eight arms. Shorter, thicker, lined with rows of suckers.
They have two tentacles. Much longer... used for quickly striking out to seize prey.
Trying to get my arms around it.
